items.description: Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ehen, Rive Calder, River Irt, River Esk

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk for a short time due to heavy rainfall which is  overnight and through the early morning of Tuesday 02/08/2022. 
Flooding of low lying land and roads near the Rivers Ehen, Calder, Irt and Esk and other watercourses, from Harrington to Annaside including low lying areas around Whitehaven, Cleator Moor, Egremont, Gosforth, Eskdale and Bootle is possible between 11:00 and 13:00 on 02/08/2022.
Rainfall is forecast to clear through this morning, with drier conditions to follow.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected after this period, however there may be standing water seen for several hours. We will not be issuing any Flood Warnings 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated during the afternoon of 02/08/2022, or as the situation changes.
